definition: (Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: Payments made from those using stored-value are seen as relatively low-risk.
sentences.chinese: 而且通过手机储值进行交易似乎成本相对较低。

sentences.english: That would be our Saver's Plus account .
sentences.chinese: 那可以试试我们的储值账户。

sentences.english: Senior Citizen Stored Value Ticket must be used together with Preferential Card.
sentences.chinese: 老年人储值票须与《广州市老年人优待证》同时使用。

sentences.english: The value of the vouchers can be deposited directly into the EasyCard for use.
sentences.chinese: 兑换券可直接储值于悠游卡中使用。

sentences.english: Is there any value-added service available with this product?
sentences.chinese: 目前仅开放储值的加值服务。

definition: bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
